result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Robert Hardt

records.addlTxt:
Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Johnson and the defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. 
Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Atty Johnson states that the matter is resolved.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
set for plea/sentencing
bond continued

11:59 AM Defendant Jason Robert Hardt appeared by phone.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Jason Robert Hardt.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:49 PM Defendant Jason Robert Hardt appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Jason Robert Hardt.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
21CM6 tracking with 22CF62:
Atty Johnson states that a waiver of Prelim would need to be set on the felony case.

BY THE COURT:  Set for waiver of Prelim
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on October 10, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:26 PM Defendant Jason Robert Hardt in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Jason Robert Hardt.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Johnson states that the matters are not yet resolved; he is meeting with the DA on Wednesday.

BY THE COURT:  Set status

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Robert Hardt appeared by video.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Jason Robert Hardt. 
Atty Johnson waives the time limits for the Prelim.  Atty Johnson states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading. 
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
21CM6 will track with this case
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Robert Hardt appeared by video. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant spoke with Atty Johnson but it is going to take a bit for him to retain him.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset so the defendant get get his Attorney.  
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*Random PBT's as recommended by Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion 
*No unsupervised contact with victim 1

3:22 PM Defendant Jason Robert Hardt appeared by video in custody from Marquette County Jail.   Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
State requests $5000.00 cash bond with conditions of absolute sobriety; not to possess or consume any alcohol. Submit to random PVT with reasonable submission and No unsupervised contact with victim 1. 
Victim makes statement. Court questions if defendant is aware of who victim 1 refers to, defendant does know. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets $2500.00 cash bond with the following conditions: *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol *Random PBT's as recommended by Law Enforcement with reasonable suspicion and * No unsupervised contact with Victim 1
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
